001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004import java.util.List;
005import java.util.Optional;
006import java.util.function.Predicate;
007import java.util.stream.Collectors;
008import java.util.stream.Stream;
009
010import org.immutables.value.Value;
011
012/**
013 * Historical patient data relevant to the ongoing simulation. Some of this is
014 * copied from the patients state, and some is updated by patient behaviour.
015 * Notably this is where contacts, and testing is stored as the history of both
016 * are needed. The simulation stores enough history for an individual to inform
017 * the current state (decided in terms of multiples of the infectious period).
018 *
019 * @see PersonTemporalState
020 * @see Person
021 * @see Outbreak
022 *
023 */
024@Value.Immutable
025public interface PersonHistory extends PersonTemporalState {
026
027        /**
028         * Retrieves a stream of all {@link Contact} objects for this patient made
029         * within the last {@code X} days (inclusive of today). This is a modelled
030         * quantity, meaning it represents all contacts regardless of whether they
031         * were observed. The method operates by concatenating the
032         * {@link #getTodaysContacts()} with the results of recursively calling
033         * {@link #getHistoricalContacts(int)}-1 on the {@link #getPrevious()} day.
034         *
035         * @param limit The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only
036         *              today).
037         * @return A {@link Stream} of {@link Contact} objects from the specified
038         *         historical period.
039         */
040        default Stream<Contact> getHistoricalContacts(int limit) {
041                if (limit == 0) { return Arrays.stream(this.getTodaysContacts()); }
042                return Stream.concat(
043                        Arrays.stream(this.getTodaysContacts()),
044                        this.getPrevious()
045                                .stream()
046                                .flatMap(ph -> ph.getHistoricalContacts(limit - 1))
047                );
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Retrieves a stream of all {@link TestResult} objects for this patient
052         * taken within the last {@code N} days (inclusive of today). This includes
053         * tests of all statuses (e.g., PENDING, POSITIVE, NEGATIVE). The method
054         * operates by concatenating the {@link #getTodaysTests()} with the results
055         * of recursively calling {@link #getHistoricalTests(int)}-1 on the
056         * {@link #getPrevious()} day.
057         *
058         * @param limit The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only
059         *              today).
060         * @return A {@link Stream} of {@link TestResult} objects from the specified
061         *         historical period.
062         */
063        default Stream<TestResult> getHistoricalTests(int limit) {
064                if (limit == 0) { return this.getTodaysTests()
065                        .stream(); }
066                return Stream.concat(
067                        this.getTodaysTests()
068                                .stream(),
069                        this.getPrevious()
070                                .stream()
071                                .flatMap(ph -> ph.getHistoricalTests(limit - 1))
072                );
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * If the person is currently infectious, this method finds the
077         * {@link PersonHistory} state at the point in time they first became
078         * infectious. This is determined by:
079         * <ol>
080         * <li>Checking if the current state {@link #isInfectious()} and
081         * {@link #isIncidentInfection()}. If both are true, this is the infection
082         * start.</li>
083         * <li>Otherwise, recursively calling {@link #getPrevious()} and checking its
084         * {@link #getInfectionStart()} until the incident infection is found.</li>
085         * </ol>
086         *
087         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the {@link PersonHistory} at the
088         *         start of the infection, or empty if not infectious.
089         */
090        @Value.Lazy @Deprecated
091        default Optional<PersonHistory> getInfectionStart() {
092                if (!this.isInfectious()) { return Optional.empty(); }
093                if (this.isIncidentInfection()) { return Optional.of(this); }
094                return this.getPrevious()
095                        .flatMap(p -> p.getInfectionStart());
096        }
097
098        // HISTORY NAVIGATION:
099
100        /**
101         * For a newly infected person, this method finds the {@link Exposure} event
102         * that represents the maximal viral exposure on the first day before the
103         * subject became infectious. This exposure is considered the primary
104         * infectious contact from an "infector". The calculation involves:
105         * <ol>
106         * <li>Identifying if there's a {@link #getNewInfection()} on this day.</li>
107         * <li>If so, finding the {@link #getLastExposure()} leading up to this new
108         * infection.</li>
109         * <li>From the {@link #getLastExposure()}, streaming through
110         * {@link #getTodaysExposures()} and finding the one with the maximum
111         * {@link Exposure#getExposure()} value.</li>
112         * </ol>
113         *
114         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the {@link Exposure} with the
115         *         maximal viral dose, or empty if not found.
116         */
117        @Deprecated @Value.Lazy
118        default Optional<Exposure> getInfectiousContact() {
119
120                return this.getNewInfection()
121                        .flatMap(
122                                ph -> ph.getLastExposure()
123                                        .flatMap(
124                                                e -> Arrays.stream(e.getTodaysExposures())
125                                                        .max(
126                                                                (c1, c2) -> Double
127                                                                        .compare(c1.getExposure(), c2.getExposure())
128                                                        )
129                                        )
130                        );
131        }
132
133        /**
134         * For a newly infected person, this method identifies the
135         * {@link PersonHistory} of the individual who transmitted the infection (the
136         * "infector"). The process involves:
137         * <ol>
138         * <li>Finding the {@link Exposure} event with the maximal viral exposure
139         * using {@link #getInfectiousContact()}.</li>
140         * <li>Retrieving the {@link PersonHistory} of the exposer from that
141         * {@link Exposure} event.</li>
142         * <li>Determining the {@link #getInfectionStart()} for that exposer to
143         * pinpoint the exact moment of their infection.</li>
144         * </ol>
145         * This ensures that all infections originating from a single infector map
146         * back to the same infection start time for that infector.
147         *
148         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the {@link PersonHistory} of the
149         *         infector at their infection start, or empty if not found.
150         */
151        @Deprecated @Value.Lazy
152        default Optional<PersonHistory> getInfector() {
153                return this.getInfectiousContact()
154                        .map(exposure -> exposure.getExposer(this))
155                        .flatMap(exposer -> exposer.getInfectionStart());
156        }
157
158        /**
159         * Finds the {@link PersonHistory} state at the start of the last episode of
160         * exposure to the virus. An "episode" is defined as a continuous run of
161         * exposures separated by less than one infectious period. The method works
162         * by:
163         * <ol>
164         * <li>Checking if the current state {@link #isIncidentExposure()}. If true,
165         * this is the last exposure start.</li>
166         * <li>Otherwise, recursively calling {@link #getPrevious()} and checking its
167         * {@link #getLastExposure()} until the incident exposure is found.</li>
168         * </ol>
169         *
170         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the {@link PersonHistory} at the
171         *         start of the last exposure episode, or empty if no recent
172         *         exposure.
173         */
174        default Optional<PersonHistory> getLastExposure() {
175                if (this.isIncidentExposure()) { return Optional.of(this); }
176                return this.getPrevious()
177                        .flatMap(p -> p.getLastExposure());
178        }
179
180        /**
181         * Calculates the maximum delay among all {@link TestResult} objects taken on
182         * the current day. This value is used when assembling the forward-looking
183         * list of test results, organized by sample date, including the delay
184         * distribution. The method streams through {@link #getTodaysTests()} and
185         * finds the maximum value of {@link TestResult#getDelay()}.
186         *
187         * @return The maximum test result delay in days for tests taken today, or 0
188         *         if no tests were taken.
189         */
190        @Value.Derived
191        default int getMaxDelay() {
192                return (int) this.getTodaysTests()
193                        .stream()
194                        .mapToLong(tr -> tr.getDelay())
195                        .max()
196                        .orElse(0);
197        }
198
199        /**
200         * Determines if a person became newly infectious on this specific day. This
201         * is distinct from being newly exposed. The method checks if the current
202         * {@link PersonHistory} state is an {@link #isIncidentInfection()}.
203         *
204         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the current {@link PersonHistory}
205         *         if the person is newly infectious today, otherwise empty.
206         */
207        @Deprecated @Value.Lazy
208        default Optional<PersonHistory> getNewInfection() {
209                if (this.isIncidentInfection()) { return Optional.of(this); }
210                return Optional.empty();
211        }
212
213        /**
214         * Retrieves the {@link PersonHistory} entry for the day immediately
215         * following the current day. This is achieved by querying the associated
216         * {@link Person} entity for its history at {@code (this.getTime() + 1)}.
217         *
218         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the {@link PersonHistory} for the
219         *         next day, or empty if not available.
220         */
221        default Optional<PersonHistory> getNext() {
222                return this.getEntity()
223                        .getHistoryEntry(this.getTime() + 1);
224        }
225
226        /**
227         * Retrieves the {@link PersonHistory} entry for the day immediately
228         * preceding the current day. This is achieved by querying the associated
229         * {@link Person} entity for its history at {@code (this.getTime() - 1)}.
230         *
231         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the {@link PersonHistory} for the
232         *         previous day, or empty if not available.
233         */
234        default Optional<PersonHistory> getPrevious() {
235                return this.getEntity()
236                        .getHistoryEntry(this.getTime() - 1);
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Recursively collects a stream of {@link PersonHistory} entries for the
241         * current day and the {@code limit} preceding days. If {@code limit} is 0,
242         * only the current {@link PersonHistory} is returned. Otherwise, it
243         * concatenates the current history with the result of calling
244         * {@code getPrevious(limit - 1)}.
245         *
246         * @param limit The number of previous days to include in the stream
247         *              (0-based, so 0 means only today).
248         * @return A {@link Stream} of {@link PersonHistory} objects, starting from
249         *         the current day and going backwards.
250         */
251        default Stream<PersonHistory> getPrevious(int limit) {
252                if (limit == 0) { return Stream.of(this); }
253                return Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), this.getPrevious(limit - 1));
254        }
255
256        /**
257         * Retrieves a stream of {@link TestResult} objects that were sampled on the
258         * current day and have their results available by a specified future
259         * {@code time}. The method calculates the difference between the specified
260         * {@code time} and the current time. If the difference is negative, an empty
261         * stream is returned. Otherwise, it filters {@link #getTodaysTests()} to
262         * include only those tests for which
263         * {@link TestResult#isResultAvailable(int)} is true at the given
264         * {@code time}.
265         *
266         * @param time The future time at which to check for result availability.
267         * @return A {@link Stream} of {@link TestResult} objects sampled today with
268         *         results available by the specified time.
269         */
270        default Stream<TestResult> getResultsBySampleDate(int time) {
271                var lim = time - this.getTime();
272                if (lim < 0) { return Stream.empty(); }
273                return this.getTodaysTests()
274                        .stream()
275                        .filter(tr -> tr.isResultAvailable(time));
276        }
277
278        /**
279         * Retrieves a stream of {@link Contact} objects that occurred within the
280         * last presumed infectious period and were detected. This is an observed
281         * quantity. The method filters the {@link #getHistoricalContacts(int)}
282         * (using {@link #infPeriod()} as the limit) to include only those contacts
283         * for which {@link Contact#isDetected()} returns true.
284         *
285         * @return A {@link Stream} of detected {@link Contact} objects relevant to
286         *         the current infectious period.
287         */
288        default Stream<Contact> getStillRelevantDetectedContacts() {
289                return this.getHistoricalContacts(this.infPeriod())
290                        .filter(c -> c.isDetected());
291        }
292
293        /**
294         * Retrieves a stream of {@link TestResult} objects that are still considered
295         * relevant based on the presumed infectious period. This is an observed
296         * quantity, meaning it reflects tests whose results would be considered
297         * impactful given the disease's progression. The method calls
298         * {@link #getHistoricalTests(int)} with the value returned by
299         * {@link #infPeriod()} as the limit.
300         *
301         * @return A {@link Stream} of {@link TestResult} objects relevant to the
302         *         current infectious period.
303         */
304        default Stream<TestResult> getStillRelevantTests() {
305                return this.getHistoricalTests(this.infPeriod());
306        }
307
308        /**
309         * A list of contacts made in this time period and their weight from the
310         * perspective of transmission (i.e. context). Weights might be less if for
311         * example the participants are wearing masks. In the future we might build
312         * contact venue into this context. This array is populated by the simulation
313         * based on the social network and mobility models.
314         *
315         * @return An array of {@link Contact} objects representing contacts made
316         *         today.
317         */
318        Contact[] getTodaysContacts();
319
320        /**
321         * A list of exposures made in this time period. These are contacts who are
322         * infectious. This array is derived from {@link #getTodaysContacts()} by
323         * filtering for contacts with infectious individuals and successful
324         * transmission events.
325         *
326         * @return An array of {@link Exposure} objects representing exposures that
327         *         occurred today.
328         */
329        Exposure[] getTodaysExposures();
330
331        /**
332         * Collects a list of {@link TestResult} objects that generate a result on
333         * the current day, regardless of when the test was taken. This method looks
334         * backwards over all possibly relevant tests (up to the infectious period).
335         * It streams through {@link #getStillRelevantTests()} and filters them using
336         * {@link TestResult#isResultToday(int)} with the current time. Note that
337         * tests with very long processing times relative to the infectious period
338         * might not be picked up.
339         *
340         * @return A {@link List} of {@link TestResult} objects whose results become
341         *         available today.
342         */
343        @Value.Lazy
344        default List<TestResult> getTodaysResults() {
345                return this.getStillRelevantTests()
346                        .filter(r -> r.isResultToday(this.getTime()))
347                        .collect(Collectors.toList());
348        }
349
350        /**
351         * The list of tests taken on this day. Initially the result will be marked
352         * as PENDING until the test is processed. (the true result is available
353         * internally to the model immediately, but not necessarily observed). This
354         * list is populated by the simulation engine when a person undergoes a test.
355         *
356         * @return A {@link List} of {@link TestResult} objects representing tests
357         *         taken today.
358         */
359        List<TestResult> getTodaysTests();
360        // TestResult[] getTodaysTests(); // cannot do because builder is added to
361        // incrementally
362
363        /**
364         * Checks if a given {@code test} condition (a {@link Predicate} on
365         * {@link PersonTemporalState}) has been true continuously every day for the
366         * last {@code limit} days, including the current day. The method works by
367         * first checking the current day. If the test is false, it immediately
368         * returns false. Otherwise, it recursively calls
369         * {@link #isContinuously(Predicate, int)} on the {@link #getPrevious()} day
370         * with a decremented limit, returning {@code false} if no previous history
371         * exists or the limit is reached.
372         *
373         * @param test  The {@link Predicate} to apply to each
374         *              {@link PersonTemporalState}.
375         * @param limit The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only
376         *              today).
377         * @return {@code true} if the test condition was met continuously throughout
378         *         the period, {@code false} otherwise.
379         */
380        default boolean isContinuously(
381                        Predicate<PersonTemporalState> test, int limit
382        ) {
383                if (limit == 0) { return test.test(this); }
384                if (!test.test(this)) { return false; }
385                return this.getPrevious()
386                        .map(p -> p.isContinuously(test, limit - 1))
387                        .orElse(Boolean.FALSE);
388        }
389
390        /**
391         * Checks if a given {@code test} condition (a {@link Predicate} on
392         * {@link PersonTemporalState}) has been true at least once within the last
393         * {@code limit} days, including the current day. The method works by first
394         * checking the current day. If the test is true, it returns true. Otherwise,
395         * it recursively calls {@link #isRecently(Predicate, int)} on the
396         * {@link #getPrevious()} day with a decremented limit, returning
397         * {@code false} if no previous history exists or the limit is reached.
398         *
399         * @param test  The {@link Predicate} to apply to each
400         *              {@link PersonTemporalState}.
401         * @param limit The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only
402         *              today).
403         * @return {@code true} if the test condition was met at least once in the
404         *         period, {@code false} otherwise.
405         */
406        default boolean isRecently(Predicate<PersonTemporalState> test, int limit) {
407                if (limit == 0) { return test.test(this); }
408                if (test.test(this)) { return true; }
409                return this.getPrevious()
410                        .map(p -> p.isRecently(test, limit - 1))
411                        .orElse(Boolean.FALSE);
412        }
413
414}
